newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL TRAINING SCRAPPED.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-MEN'S DOWNHILL TRAINING SCRAPPED.

text.p: Mild overnight conditions led to the cancellation of men's World Cup downhill training on Thursday.
International Ski Federation organisers feared a practice run could destroy the dreaded and demanding Streif piste.
They said the track would be saved ahead of Friday's two-run sprint downhill and Saturday's famous "Hahnenkamm" race.
Competitors used the full 3.2 km course on Wednesday, with Norway's Atle Skaardal the quickest ahead of Luc Alphand of France and Austria's Fritz Strobl.
